title: Game Polish, Juice & Player Experience
overview: Make your game feel amazing with screen shake, particles, sound effects, tweening, and other polish techniques that enhance player experience.
objectives: Add screen shake and camera effects
Enhance game feel with audio and visual feedback

sections.title: Game Polish & Juice

miniProject.title: Add Polish to Your Game
miniProject.description: Enhance an existing game with screen shake, particles, tweening, and sound effects
steps: Add squash/stretch to player on jump/land
Add sound effects for all actions
Add background music with fade in/out

questions.question: What is 'game juice'?
options: Visual and audio feedback that makes games feel satisfying
questions.correctAnswer: Visual and audio feedback that makes games feel satisfying
questions.explanation: Juice is the extra polish (particles, shake, sounds) that makes games feel great.

questions.question: What is lerp?
questions.explanation: Lerp smoothly interpolates between two values, useful for smooth movement.

questions.question: Game feel techniques?
questions.explanation: Screen shake, particles, and audio enhance feel. Resolution affects visuals but not feel.

questions.question: Why add freeze frames on impact?
questions.explanation: Brief pause on impact makes hits feel more powerful and satisfying.

questions.question: Explain why feedback for every player action is important
questions.correctAnswer: Immediate feedback (visual, audio, haptic) confirms the player's action registered, makes controls feel responsive, and creates emotional connection with the game
questions.explanation: Feedback is crucial for making games feel responsive and engaging.

troubleshooting.solution: Less is more! Start subtle and increase gradually. Add intensity options.
Use object pooling. Limit max particles. Cull offscreen particles.
